content: Is there a proof of |x| = if x ≥ 0 then x else -x in mathlib? It isn't hard to prove, but this seems like it should be somewhere in mathlib

Thanks. I have a PMF, but I need to use the probabilities as reals, not non-negative reals, so I have to write .toReal everywhere. Is there a way to override the default coercion to α → ℝ≥0∞ and just make it coerce to α → ℝ?
However we have setup some definitions to consider a measure as real-valued in PFR: https://github.com/teorth/pfr/blob/master/PFR/ForMathlib/MeasureReal.lean
